meanings.definition: The process by which an amino group is transferred from one molecule to another.
meanings.sent1: During transamination, the amino group moves between molecules.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study transamination to understand how amino groups transfer.
meanings.sent3: The classroom erupted in laughter when the molecules started playing a game of pass-the-amino-group during transamination.
meanings.sent4: In the busy city of molecules, transamination is like rush hour traffic, with amino groups changing lanes constantly.
meanings.sent5: Transamination is like a busy airport, with amino groups as passengers moving from one molecule to another.

meanings.definition: The transfer of an amino group from an amino acid to a keto acid.
meanings.sent1: The transamination process involves moving an amino group from one type of acid to another.
meanings.sent2: During transamination, the amino group shifts from an amino acid to a keto acid.
meanings.sent3: At the amino acid party, the keto acid was the life of the transamination dance floor.
meanings.sent4: The transamination event was like a relay race, passing the amino group baton from one acid to another.
meanings.sent5: In the world of acids, transamination is the amino group's grand adventure from one acid to another.
